doc.title: Grand Hotel Babylon 2008
doc.plot: Based on the novels Grand Hotel Babylon and Buried Alive by Arnold Bennet. When famous artist William Blythe uses the death of his man servant to assume his identity he finds a way to hide from the world and live away from the glare of publicity that he abhors. However his status means that he be buried in Westminster Abbey,and realizing his mistake Blythe tries to reverse his decision, but it's too late. Finding love and a life with a really down to earth widow who accepts his eccentricities without question, he lives comfortably and finds a peace he never thought he'd attain. However forced to paint again by monetary woes and also a burning desire to capture his wife on canvas all goes well until the paintings find their way to the most famous collector of his works. Though not signed his unique style is apparent to the dealer and to maximize their value he is forced to bring a court action against Blythe to prove that he s alive and well, and not buried in Westminster. The ensuing court battle and the tumultuous upheaval in front of the press is more than Blythe can bear. A dramatic conclusion awaits.
